It's a walkable place. Nice house, hosts were soo hospitable! Everything is clean. U can cook for yourself, take a shower, watch TV. Highly recommend!

Tr√®s bon accueil avec des h√¥tes tr√®s r√©actifs pour r√©pondre aux messages avec des informations tr√®s clairs. Localisation un peu √©loign√©e de Manhattan mais facile d'acc√®s par le m√©tro. L'appartement est tr√®s joli et propre. La chambre √©tait tr√®s bien, juste un petit b√©mol pour des bruits d'eau dans une tuyauterie parfois un peu g√™nants dans la nuit. Les deux petits chiens sont tr√®s mignons et tout aussi accueillants que leurs ma√Ætres.
Christa and Zach are very friendly! I could stay comfortable because the room was clean, pretty, and quiet.

Very friendly and accommodating couple providing a crucial service for low-budget travelers. It was nice to have my own TV in my room and i really appreciated the space heater! I had a last-minute change in my itinerary and Zach and Christa let me stay a few hours extra. The dogs are super friendly and don't bark very much for small dogs! I loved having the dogs around. I have no complaints, besides the fact that the comforter was a bit too warm for my taste. Would definitely recommend and would stay again!
Christa and Zach were great! Very helpful and responsive. The room was great. I would definitely stay with them again.

Christa and Zach's apartment is very comfortable  and you have everything you need to have a good time in there. It is close to lines 2 and 5 of the subway and also some buses.
I stayed there for almost 3 weeks (for job), and as you can imagine is a long time to spend in someone's house: in my case, I missed that there is not a single table in the bedroom and if you want to work the only table is the dining room and they are usually in that place. You also must love dogs because they have 2 little dogs.
Christa is very responsive and the neighbor hood is safe.

Loved the simple, cozy aesthetic! Christa's a really generous and accommodating host. I'm really grateful for the instructions she provides to get to her place in case New York newbies get lost with the public transportation system.

Christa and Zach are great and helpful hosts. Full furnished kitchen, nice room with comfortable bed made me feel like home and relaxed after all day of walking around the New York. I would definietly recommend their place.

I had a very comfortable stay at Christa & Zach's. The space is clean and cozy, and it was great to be able to use the kitchen to make tea and cook meals, and to do laundry too. Subway access is just a couple blocks away. I felt comfy, welcome, and safe here.

I love staying here. Christa and Zach make you feel right at home without getting in your way. Their dogs are super cute. The beds are very comfortable. Communication is always great. The keyless locks let you check in at any time. The neighborhood is diverse but safe and gives you an authentic idea of what NYC is really like. The jerk chicken you get here is world class! I stay here whenever I'm in the city.

The place is nice, is well located and they have two nice puppies.

100% recommendable.

Christa and Zach were very gracious hosts. I thoroughly enjoyed my stay. The location in a residential neighborhood was wonderful. I felt safe. The house was very clean and looked newly updated. The dogs were precious and very loving. I was able to study for the NYPD exam in a very quiet house with other guests as well. I would definitely recommend this Airbnb.

Christa and Zach were amazing hosts. the place was clean, cozy and just as described. They are always willing to help if you need something. The train station is very close and the neighborhood is nice. Plus, Ollie and Cookie are lovely, they make such a great company! I had an amazing time in NYC, I'd definitely book this room again.
Very comfy abode, with everything you'll need! Close to the subway and the line goes straight into Manhattan. The bed was super comfy and Christa was a great host, thanks for everything :)
Enjoyed the stay at Christa and Zach's very much. They strike excellent balance between being hospitable yet respecting guest's privacy. And Ollie and Cookie are awesome smart puppies !!
Amazing! Close to the subway (all you have to do is take the 2 and takes you to Times Square)! Very nice and clean! Super sweet couple! Would stay again!!!!
This is my third time staying here and I can't wait to come back! Christa and Zach are very welcoming and wonderful hosts. Great communication, great space!

This room and location was perfect for the type of trip I was taking. It was great for a short trip and for traveling solo. 

Christa and Zach are very friendly and welcoming hosts, not always something you can find in the city. Everything was clean and description of the room on the site compared to in-person was spot-on. 

I loved that Christa and Zach left tips for navigating the city and how to get to the train from their apartment, it was very helpful.

Room was as described, small but perfectly serviceable. Keyless entry was great. Kitchen fully equipped, but no microwave so be aware if you're looking to quickly reheat meals you might need to go the old-fashioned way. I stayed a few weeks and felt right at home--Christa and Zach did everything possible to make me feel welcome. Subway is only a short walk to the 2 and 5. Location is a little tucked away from things locally though, with a short walk to grocery stores but a subway ride to get a decent coffee/breakfast etc. Having Prospect Park nearby was nice too, especially considering there's a Saturday farmer's market at Grand Army Plaza and Smorgasburg on Sundays. Would stay again.

I absolutely recommend staying at Christa and Zach's! The listing is accurate. Access to public transportation is close to their residential area. The bedroom was cozy and the bed was comfortable.I really appreciated being able to do a bit of laundry and drop off my bags early. I'm glad I was able to spend a few nights here while visiting NYC.

Stayed with Christa and Zach for a couple of days when I first arrived in NYC. Christa was quick to respond to any messages and gave extremely detailed and useful directions for getting to their place from the airport via the train. She also supplied detailed info on the local trains to get to Manhattan. 

Check in was extremely easy with the door code and the room was small but comfortable for one. 

Christa also provided good areas to visit in the surrounding neighbouhoods for places to eat and drink and ensured that I had everything I needed to enjoy my stay. 

I also loved the dogs Cookie and Ollie.

Christa and Zach were welcoming and their space is lovely.  They were warm and accommodating, always making sure I had everything I needed. There place is a short walk to the subway and gets you to Manhattan easily. Plus, their dogs are adorable.
Lovely place to be a home away home. Convenient location, nice hosts absolutely gonna book this again next time in town!

Great stay.  This should be a model for other airbnb hosts--they're THAT good. 
I thought that the way these hosts Christa and Zach handled the coded-entry locks was extremely easy and straightforward and respectful to the guests, and not stressful on anyone.  Also, the folder with the things to do and see in Brooklyn and Manhattan was particularly well-written along with being extremely helpful. In addition, I'm also highly recommending them to anyone who doesn't mind traveling a bit into Brooklyn.  Amazing shops and health food store near their place, on Rogers, just north of Church.  Subway access is so easy, to the 5 and 2 train, except the 2 train doesn't run on weekends --and weekends start on Friday evening...this is a little bit important to know.  Thanks again guys for a wonderful stay.
The space is wonderful.

Christa and Zach's house is situated in a nice and green street in Brooklyn, with a good connection with public transport. I stayed in the room in the front of the house. It's on the small side but had a comfy bed for 2, TV, airco, closet and good wifi. The room and the rest of the house were cosy and clean. I didn't use the kitchen, only for coffee once, but i you want, there's coffee, tea, cereal and milk to use and you can put your own food in the fridge and use their kitchen and spices to cook if you like. 
The place has a good shower, nothing fancy but perfectly fine. Also, the doggies are very sweet and quiet, I did't even know they were there. 
I didn't meet Christa and Zach when I arrived and during my stay. But when I left I met Zach briefly and he seemed like a nice guy. But the directions of the house they sent and they also put in the room were very clear so it was no problem at all. All in all a nice stay and good value.
Stay here!! What a great ace to stay. Great hosts, great value, great location .... if you are fortunate enough to be accepted by these super hosts then look no further!

Good place for budget travellers, clean and cosy (and cute dogs!). The room is rather small but when you're busy exploring NY, there's more to do than hang out there I'd say. Subway is close by and one gets to see a little bit more of New York than just Manhattan and the typical tourist stuff. I didn't have too much interaction with the hosts but communication went smoothly via Mail/Phone and they're really nice folks.

I ended up moving over to a friend's place before staying a full night, but I did take a nap and shower at Christa and Zach's following a red-eye from LAX. It is a great little spot, very conveniently located on a residential classic BK street, near a train stop. Nice room, with a nice bed and air conditioning. House was clean, bath was clean. The hosts practiced prompt communication and totally accommodated me. I highly recommend Christa and Zach's place.
Great location, accessible to the subway, prospect park and easy access in and out of NY City.  Parking if you have a car is challenging but doable.  I would stay there again.

I spend 10 days at Christa and Zach's place- it was lovely. Ollie and Cookie (their dogs) made me laugh and smile and made my day! Communication was great at all times, and they made me feel super comfortable. Thank you!

The apt is very nice. I really just slept and showered, but the bedroom was very nice and comfortable, a/c worked well,  bathroom had all the necessities. Hosts were really nice and friendly. It was very convenient to the subway and lots of stores close by.  I am a native NY'er and used to live fairly close by so I was familiar with the neighborhood and knew that it was safe. This is definitely not SOHO or TRIBECA so If you are not used to a real NYC neighborhood, it might seem kind of sketchy, scary, and overwhelming. It definitely is busy, crowded, a little  grungy, and ethnically diverse. But really totally safe. I am a 53 year old woman and was totally comfortable walking alone there.  But how you feel about the area is really dependent upon your attitude.
Christa and Zach's place was genuinely amazing! Very close to the subway - so perfect if you commute to Manhattan. The house is really nice and beautifully decorated. Super cute dogs!

I stayed with Christa and Zach for a bit more than a week while on a trip to NYC. The house is nice, spacey and the two of them are super flexible and greatly experienced hosts.

Flatbush has a nice neighbourhood vibe to it and one can definitely feel very "at home" here. The room I had is tiny but they are totally upfront about that in the description and I didn't mind at all. Who wants to stay in when in NYC for a limited time anyway, right?! But yeah, for more than one person it might be less ideal.

A few things to keep in mind. I shared the house with C&Z and temporarily with other guests, too. While they try to manage and coordinate nicely, that still can mean 5 people for one bathroom in the morning. I guess when on vacation that is no problem at all though. NYC is vast and the 2/5 metro isn't that far from the house. However, make sure that suit your needs or u might end end up spending lots of time on the public transport.

In general I can recommend staying with C&Z.

Easy stay at Christa's and Zach's! Their two little dogs are lovable and cute. The room was as described and had a comfortable bed. The neighborhood is very diverse and was in a safe area. Of course anywhere you stay in NY will have loud cars drive by at night and people out and about but it's a great place to stay if you're planning on seeing Brooklyn!
Beautiful, clean, cozy sleep at a great value for a business trip. Adorable dogs. Overall, great stay! Thank you!
Warm hospitality with interesting hosts. Made you feel at home with great directions and dining suggestions along with advice on sights to see...
Christa is the greatest. Everyone was friendly. Room was good. Read their description of the place. Once it works for you go ahead and book it.
Christa and Zach were communicative and flexible with check in time - very nice place and easy to check in. Provided a nice clean, private space.

This Airbnb has great value.  While it's in the southern end of Brooklyn it's 7-10 minute walk to the subway, thankfully as I commuted up to Midtown every day for work.  The apartment is large and spacious.  Furthermore Christa and Zach were prompt with any questions I had.  If you are traveling on a budget I recommend this Airbnb for sure.

I really enjoyed my stay here and it was by far my best stay with airbnb yet. Christa and Zach are very friendly and their dogs are just lovely! It's easy to get to wherever you want to go exploring New York.
Christa and Zach were very friendly hosts ‚Äì great conversationalists with lovely furry friends. Would definitely recommend!

Christa and Zach‚Äôs place is super cool. Location is good as it‚Äôs close to the subway, and public transport is a breeze. just expect to travel a solid 40 minutes on the subway to get to the touristy places in manhattan. The keyless entry is the best as well. They‚Äôve really given a lot of thought and effort into hosting and it certainly made my stay very enjoyable.
Love, love, love staying here! This is my fourth time staying and each time has been such a wonderful experience! If you‚Äôre coming to nyc...stay here!
Awesome stay. Thank you!
Cute, cozy and convenient into Manhattan! Great value for a short stay in New York.  Christa is very welcoming and communicative.
great place to stay and as described! hosts were great with very quick communication!
The apartment was exactly as described. Walking distance to the subway. Very comfortable bed and clean living space. The dogs were very cute and friendly!

Exactly as described. Small space, but perfect for a home base while exploring the city. About four blocks from the train - super convenient for getting in and out of the city (please note that this is a bit further out in Brooklyn and a local stop train). Comfy bed! Christa is very friendly and gives great suggestions of what to try close by - especially to someone who‚Äôs been to New York a few times.
Safe and clean place to stay. Owners are wonderful and very helpful. Check n was painless. Thank you

Their house was clean, and quiet.
Location is easy to get subway station.
If you don‚Äôt have a big baggage with your trip, it‚Äôs recommended to stay here.
Great place! Quiet, neat and hosts were very helpful and understanding.

Clean room and very comfortable bed! Easy check-in/check out. Great location near subway. Parking is definitely do-able, although would recommend just using public transportation/uber/lyft  if possible due to street sweeping rules.
Great flat with everything I needed. It is a very quit place and the subway station nearby. Chris and Zach were very courteous and everything was perfect!

Its just what you need if you‚Äôre visiting NYC. Close to the 2-5 lines that take you straight to manhatten or anywhere else.

Nice small room with an AC (didnt need it). Great bed! 

Only met Christa, but she‚Äôs great. They have two cute dogs who really like to cuddle.
Great place! Very close to the subway. The neighborhood was quiet and safe. Zach and Christa were very friendly and gave me many useful tips on getting around! I would definitely recommend it! :)

Christa & Zach are incredible! Their place is beautiful and it is exactly as it is described in the posting and in the photos. The location is a quick five-minute walk to the subway which connects directly to Manhattan. Check in was extremely smooth and they both are extremely responsible with my questions/concerns with the last minute changes to my travel schedule! They value your own privacy and will give you the space that you need. They were kind of enough to offer breakfast so I did not have to worry about it before my interview. It's the little things when you travel. Thank you for being the sweetest and most welcoming of hosts! Cannot wait to stay again!
great location in Brooklyn, very affordable and great hosts.  I will stay again and again with them if available when I am in Brooklyn
They have lovely dogs. I enjoyed playing with dogs!

Had a wonderful quick stay in Christa and Zach‚Äôs home! I only got to meet Christa (and the puppies!) because I was there for such a short time, but she was kind and welcoming. Their home is beautiful and clean. The location and proximity to the subway is perfect. Highly recommend. Thank you so much!

This was a great and worry-free stay in Brooklyn! Christa and Zach had amazing hospitality and communication about everything. Great recommendations, privacy and overall stay! If you‚Äôre traveling on a budget this is a great option :)

Great value spot to stay in NYC! It‚Äôs a bit of a trek along the 2 to Manhattan but not too bad and totally worth it for the price. Christa and Zach were very helpful and hospitable, I would absolutely recommend them as hosts,

I stayed at Christa & Zach's place before the Brooklyn Half Marathon and it was a great spot to be close to the MTA to get to the start with plenty of time. The room was clean and nice as a place to get some rest in between exploring the city and racing down the streets! There weren't too many food options nearby though, so I'd recommend future guests eat out or grab some groceries before arriving.
Chris and Zach's place was great! Convenient location and super hospitable. I would definitely stay again.

Christa and Zach's space was very clean and exactly as described. I was in town for less than a day for a job interview nearby and their place was perfect for it. They are definitely pros at hosting--every part of my stay was organized, comfortable, and super smooth, almost hotel-like.
Perfect location for people like me who love taking the subway all over NYC. With two friendly dogs, a comfortable room, and great Caribbean food close by, I had an excellent stay.
Christa and Zach are great and helpful hosts.

Christa and Zach were great about communicating with me. Their house was really lovey and cute. The dogs are adorable and Christa and Zach were both very kind. Everything was very clean and organized. The subway was a short walk away and it was easy enough to get into the city. I had a great stay and would definitely go back :)

Christa and Zach are such wonderful hosts. And I had a great time during my short staying in their lovely apartment, although I don‚Äôt stay much time in their during my stay. Their dogs, Oliver and Cookie, are super friendly and always quiet and well-behave. I would highly recommend any of those with limited budget and seeking for a stay in NYC to stay in this small but neat and cozy apartment with the wonderful hosts!
So fancy, comfortable and clean place! The route from the subway station is easy. They were really helpful and kindly taught me information about transportation or something. Thank you so much!

This was a really fun place to stay for my 3-day NY adventure! Subway is very close. The house was cute and room was clean. Christa and Zach gave great recommendations!! Book it if it's open, you won't find anything as good at this price point :)!

Great hosts! Super cute and nice home. I was very comfortable here. No issues with the actual home. However, this area was not nice and there are no places close by to go eat or get a coffee, and in my opinion, isn‚Äôt ideal for tourists who don‚Äôt know NY or haven‚Äôt been here before. I used to live in NYC and didn‚Äôt feel comfortable in the area.
Breakfast is not provided as advertised on their Airbnb. However the place is clean and close to station.

Fantastic space with a great location near the subway. Zach and Christa had quick communication and helped me out with some last minute questions I had. The space was amazing and relaxing as well. I would absolutely recommend it to anyone traveling in Brooklyn or New York!
A really nice room. All amenities are very good. They also have two cute dogs  welcoming you when I go in. The location is good and safe. You can walk to the nearest subway within 10 minutes.

Valentina and Arnaud were very kind and available; they made our staying comfortable helping   us with tips to go around the city more efficiently.  

Thanks for everything.

host.host_location: New York, New York, United States
host.host_about: I am very out going. Helpfull, kind person. I like to see others happy. I love to keep my surrounding  clean and quiet.  Quiet knowledge of Queens Brooklyn and City.

reviews.comments: Paulette is very welcoming and kind. She made sure I was comfortable - she gave me directions, and even made me breakfast in the morning.

It was a pleasure to meet paulette. Her home is extremely clean and cozy. Paulette is extremely professional, courteous and knowledgeable of queens and manhattan. I sincerely appreciate her kindness and I look forward to the opportunity to visit her home again.

MY experienc while staying was good. was very grateful to Paulette for allowing me to store my bags. when i went to pick them up, they were outside in the rain and my electronics (laptop, straightener etc) were ruined beyond repair. the place isnt in the best area and i felt uncomfortable walking there at night by myself, but the bed was comfortable and I enjoyed my room. No windows in room, which may be something for other guests to know, I was okay, I was there only 2 nights.
Paulette and Curtis were very helpful and welcoming. The room had everything I needed and was a very handy place to stay after flying into JFK.
Stedet l√• greit til ift flyplassen, kort vei med taxi, men tungvint √• komme seg til byen (NYC ) dagen etter. Hyggelig og hjelpsomme vertskap. Rommet var i trang kjeller litt skummelt.

Although I didn't meet Paulette, she made the check in process very easy. Lots of stairs but doable. Basic, clean accommodations. Across the street from a nice park for those who loves to exercise. Would definitely stay again
Very close to JFK airport.

Bon s√©jour. J'ai chosi cet appart pour son entr√©e priv√©e (je rentrais tard tous les soirs). Il y a 2 autres chambres au m√™me niveau. Tr√®s pratique depuis l'a√©roport JFK !! Par contre j'ai compris trop tard que la localisation n'est pas √† Jamaica. (Apr√®s r√©servation quand j'ai demand√© l'adresse pr√©cise).
The family was very nice even when I arrived there at midnight. The place was clean and worth the price. It was convenient, not far from the airport.

I arrived with heavy bags on a hot summer evening, and Paulette welcomed me with much-appreciated glasses of iced tea and cool water. She was a friendly and helpful host throughout my stay, and gave me plenty of useful advice about public transport.

The room itself is clean and comfortable, with a large bed and good-quality mattress. It's in a basement, so even without air conditioning it doesn't get too hot in summer.  There's also a large electric fan if you do need to cool off. The only downside was a strange chemical smell in the room - I never figured out where it came from.

Despite being close to JFK airport, you can't hear any aircraft noise from the room, and I got a good night's sleep on all three nights I stayed. There are other guest rooms in the basement, however, so please be considerate and try to keep quiet late at night.

The house is in a pleasant neighbourhood, with just a short walk to local shops and a convenient bus service to Jamaica Center Metro station (for E, J, and Z trains).

Overall, the room was good value and I enjoyed my stay.
Great location for JFK and Paulette was incredibly helpful with any questions i had for her.  Lots of shops close by for basic needs and right next to bus routes.

First, let me say, for the price, I expected my lodging was to be modest, to say the least. I chose this AirB&B because of proximity to friends; and I was planning on late nights and early mornings, anyway. However, the strong; and I mean strong, mothball smell; and the stale, questionable sheets are the primary reasons for my reduced ratings.

To put it gently, I despise the scent of mothballs, with a passion! If you use them, more power to you; but at least put it in the description. The smell was so pungent, in my room, that there were urine undertones to it; (or at least I hope those were the mothballs) and half a bottle of Febreeze couldn't mask it. 

Being there five days, I begrudgingly accepted it; and once I left for the day I just put it in the back of my mind. However, today when arrived at the airport I realized the scope of the smell. Despite all my Febreezing, mothball funk had gotten into everything; my Bose Quiet Comforts, Sperrys, backpack, suitcase, everything! I can only imagine how I smelled to my friends; smh. 

As far as the bedding, not only was it mothbally; but it was also hard; as if it hadn't been washed in months. Because my arrival/leaving time was an average of 2am to 6am; I just repeated my nightly mantra "It was only 280 for six nights; it was only 280 for six nights".

Other problems were tiny room with no circulation; only a box fan for air; and a shower Simone Biles would have trouble fitting into. 

Obviously this review may seem as an exercise in dissuasion; but actually, it's not. It's more of a "If you're ballin on a budget in NYC; only need a place to s3 ... sleep, shower, and s***" review this is a good place; just be at peace with smelling like your grandma's house and living like a Spartan.

I've spent one night in this room, it was clean and nice. Its close to JFK airport, so if you have a car you can get there in 5-10 minutes. I did not have a car and my arrival was rather late, but Paulette was very kind to me, she is a very nice host. The only thing is that the room is underground, so you cannot open a window( But its not very important for 1 night. With a window this room will cost much more))
Thank you!
Nice environment
Great place enjoyed my stay

Host was very present and kind. Made her best efforts to be accommodating. I booked last minute because my flight out of JFK was canceled and it was very conveniently close to the airport. Was able to get an Uber at 5 AM to catch my flight for only $10.
This is a very convinient place for a short stay mostly if you are traveling from JFK. I would totally stay again if I had another long layover
Clean but small, close to jfk. A bit over priced for what you get but convenient
the place was exactly as described. Ms Paulette was amazing. the neighborhood was pleasant & quiet
The host is so nice. perfect place to stay to wait for flight x)

I didnt find the right entrance and unfortuantely rang the bell on the wrong door. Paulette wasn't happy with me and Im very sorry for doing so. Other than that the room was perfect for a layover in NY.

Molto vicino al JFK: 10 minuti (consiglio di scaricare app Uber: veloce, pratico e permette di sapere in anticipo quanto coster√† e pagare in anticipo con carta di credito). 
Paulette e suo marito molto disponibili e gentili.
Loro vivono nella casa, le stanze si trovano al di sotto del piano terra e ci sono 3 stanze private con una cucina e 2 bagni da condividere, tutto molto pulito.
Paulette was really nice and her place was exactly what I needed. It's the perfect place to go if you have a long layover. It's half the price of most hotels in the area.
Great location, close to the airport, Paulette and her husband were very supportive. Thank You!
A great spot for the overnight layover, but I noticed the park the next morning looked great for a run or a walk!
Very thorough housing arrangement with lovely breakfast. Highly recommend!
Perfect if you need to accomodate bext to JFK. Available parking street. Attentive host.

This spot is great for a layover, or in lieu to a vacation destination. It's not conducive for spending significant time in the apt, because it does get noisy. Check in was easy, the place is clean, and the kitchen stocked. Thanks

Had a great stay. Everything was clean. And Paulette is very helpful and accommodating. Plus the location being close to JK Airport which was convenient for me. In the fridge I had peanut butter, jelly and bread always a jug of fresh water. The peace I needed I found and I also recommend the Deli which is close to the house. Great stay!!
Quiet place, comfortable room.

This is a budget place to stay before/after a JFK flight. It is one-fourth the price of a hotel in that area so do not expect hotel-like service. The hosts were helpful and very quick to respond to questions. Just a heads up, I felt the room was very cold in the morning, so bring your own blankets/heavy clothes for sleeping. But overall, the price justifies everything!

What to say abt Paulette...

On early morning I was searchinh for a "cab" to reach JFK but Paulette took trouble & arranged cab immediately within-a-minute, that 2 for just $ 20, thank you dear Paulette, God bless you...
Great place to stay for the night, exactly as advertised

I chose Paulette's place due to the proximity to JFK Airport. As I read "Flexibe check in" in the add, I had no previous worries about arriving early in the morning. Bedroom was not available (about few minutes to 8 am) and host showed certain bad humor due to the time of my arrival. Finally, some minutes later, I could settle my things at the booked place and enjoy the city. Also, the heating system and courtains (there was a light outside in the corridor during all night) must be improved.

If you are looking for a clean crash pad this is not the best option.  However, if you just need a bed after a long overseas flight then you cant beat the price.  I was about to spend $220 on a hotel before I found Paulette's listing.  All in all, her place got the job done.  Its proximity to the airport is convienent.  Just not the cleanest or most comfortable stay I've had with Airbnb.

Good for a short stay by the airport between flights, can't beat the price , hotel in the area is expensive . It is a little difficult to drag the luggage down the stairs before getting to the room , but again , for the price , it's better than expected. I had trouble getting in , but Paulette was very accommodating , answering my call close to 2 o'clock in the morning, so thank you. Overall, I am happy.
Very nice and helpful host.

Perfect flight stopover for my daughter, first time flying alone. Paulette gave great help on how to find her and which taxis to use which made it much less daunting. 
Would definitely use again.
She was welcoming, made sure I had everything, answered all my questions about the city/place and overall the best place to stay close to JFK.

This was January in NY and that does not do it.  I slept with my sweatshirt on and the towel that was provided on top of me to try and get some extra warmth, but really did not sleep.  It is hard to tell from the picture because the sheets (which are much nicer in the picture) look like a comforter.  They are not.  What you get is the thin blanket that is folded up on the bed in the picture.  It seems others are happy with this rental.  Again, it would have been "ok" for me except for this.   Also be aware that their are drapes in the room which are not completely solid and I had to hide in a corner of the room to change clothes as I was worried that the person in the kitchen could see through them into my room.

name: Charming brick brownstone (2nd floor)
summary: 100 year old building with original details in diverse, artsy neighborhood, close to bars, restaurants and 2 subway lines (L and M.)  Lots of space and great light, very homey, plenty of books. Great place to try on the experience of living in Brooklyn.
description: 100 year old building with original details in diverse, artsy neighborhood, close to bars, restaurants and 2 subway lines (L and M.)  Lots of space and great light, very homey, plenty of books. Great place to try on the experience of living in Brooklyn. If you're staying here, it is because I am away. But I'm available over text and phone and my friend and co-host Amy is often downstairs and can help with any issues. We are close to the L and M subway stops. There is street parking but also street cleaning 4 days a week so you'll need to be on top of the moving your car. With a little planning this isn't too much of a headache. If you arrive late at night, you might find yourself driving around a bit for a space.
transit: We are close to the L and M subway stops. There is street parking but also street cleaning 4 days a week so you'll need to be on top of the moving your car. With a little planning this isn't too much of a headache. If you arrive late at night, you might find yourself driving around a bit for a space.
interaction: If you're staying here, it is because I am away. But I'm available over text and phone and my friend and co-host Amy is often downstairs and can help with any issues.

host.host_about: I'm a designer and researcher with a specialty in healthcare. I co-direct a non-profit called The Patient Revolution.  I've lived all over the US; both coasts, the top and the bottom. I've lived in Brooklyn for about 5 years and before that  I was in Minnesota for 7 years while working for Mayo Clinic.

reviews.comments: Maggie was a welcoming host, her neighbourhood was so much fun. Her place is 2 streets away from this amazing begel deli, and is about 15 minutes to Williamsburg on the train. We spent a lot of time exploring Brooklyn and Manhattan. It's definitely a city I cannot wait to come visit/ live in. Thanks so much for the stay, it was clean and homely. I recommend to anyone wanting to stay in Brooklyn!
on a pass√©e un bon s√©jours logement bien situer dans Brooklyn proche commerces de m√©tros

This was the best Airbnb I've ever stayed in! The appartment was beautiful - really well styled and felt super clean and taken care of. It had everything we needed and we all felt right at home right away. It's near 2 subway stations that get you easily to Manhattan or around Brooklyn. The neighbourhood is really cool, it's a big mix of cool bars, local businesses and plenty of places to eat around the corner. On top of that Maggie was an absolute star with communication and even though we didn't get a chance to meet her we felt totally taken care of - we'd love to visit again!

I put my Mom and sister up at Maggie's apt for four days. Her apt was in close proximity to the Bushwick neighborhood I live in so it was really convenient. What a gem Maggie apt is. Very nostalgic with vintage relics of that had a 50's contemporary modern feel to it. We are from Texas so the Texas relics stood out. It is an absolutely great location. Very close to the best coffee around, Variety coffee roasters and other great cafe's restaurants and bars in the neighborhood bordering Bushwick and Ridgewood. A highly recommended stay for a cozy, spacious Brownstone style vibe with very thorough communication from an accommodating host.

Maggie's place was my first ever airbnb, and I'm so glad it was!  This place was the perfect home away from home for my friend & I, and it gave us a true taste of what living in New York is like!  Her home is in a great location only a short walk from the subway, and about a 30 minute trip to Manhattan. The place itself was even better in person!  For New York, it was a great size & very cozy. I loved everything about staying here, and I would EASILY stay here again in the future. As for Maggie, she was a great host!  I knew if I needed her, she would be quick to contact.  I had such a great time, and Maggie's place really helped make that happen.

The Bleecker House has a unique character.  It brings back memories of visiting an old friend living in this type of house in the area when I was young.  It also holds special memory because my fiance and I eloped and used The Bleecker House as our home.

The apartment is clean and comfortable.  The internet connection is fast and reliable.  The kitchen is well-stocked with all the necessities for cooking.  I enjoyed the varieties of tea that Maggie has.

The area in a mix of residentials and stores.  It is also a mix of old and new.  There are many eateris and bars within walking distance.  A large supermarket is just a few blocks away near Myrtle Ave.

Parking could be an issue but the L train is only a few blocks away. 

We hope we could come back here on our anniversaries.  :-)

This was our first trip to NYC and Maggie's place added to the adventure of it all. Communication was great with Maggie. Her place was clean and comfortable. The community was friendly and we would definitely stay there again!

Maggie's place was so beautifully decorated. Her home is clean, lots of sun coming in. Apple TV, wifi, and a cute kitchen made the stay worthwhile. Beds were comfortable and kitchen was fully equipped with anything you might need to cook at home during your stay. Would definitely recommend to someone! 30 mins from Manhattan by Uber - didn't get to experience public trans but other reviews have.

Maggie's place is really charming and definitely what I was expecting from a Brooklyn apartment. It is located close to two metro lines (street is very calm though) and it's quite easy to move around Brooklyn, as well as to go to Manhattan or other areas of NY.
Surprisingly large space for the city! And beautifully decorated, clean, friendly atmosphere. Near the subway too!

Maggie's place was AS billed, very "homey", clean, comfortable, and excellent location! Diners, bars, markets all within walking distance and only a flew blocks from subway service to the city! We shall return! (turntable and record collection was outstanding!)

If you are thinking of staying here, do it! Maggie and Amy are easy to communicate with, very accommodating, and hospitable. I can‚Äôt say enough about their place... so much character and the perfect location to catch the subway. The beds are very comfortable, and the space is full of plants and cool art. No hesitation staying here again!

A beautiful apartment in a great part of Brooklyn. Everything you could wish for on your doorstep... bars, restaurants, grocery stores etc. Maggie was great at communicating and made check in really easy even though we arrived past midnight. Thank you for a lovely stay!

Maggie's apartment is easily the most beautiful AirBnb I've stayed in. Impeccably decorated yet extremely homey, the apartment was very well kept and peaceful. It's located a short walk to the L and M lines, making it easy to get to other parts of Brooklyn and into Manhattan. Maggie is a very kind and generous host who responded very quickly to any questions we had (and if you're lucky, you might get to meet her adorable dog too!). Co-host Amy downstairs was also very helpful and made check in easily accessible for us. 10/10 recommend and hope I have a chance to stay in Maggie's place again in the future.

name: City Views Close to SI Ferry
summary: Gorgeous views of New York City, downtown Manhattan, Verrazano Bridge, Statue of Liberty right from the Terrace of my historic house. My place is good for couples, families (with kids), and big groups. Smart TV with free Netflix!
space: The Space has four rooms, eat-in kitchen and a huge open terrace
description: Gorgeous views of New York City, downtown Manhattan, Verrazano Bridge, Statue of Liberty right from the Terrace of my historic house. My place is good for couples, families (with kids), and big groups. Smart TV with free Netflix! The Space has four rooms, eat-in kitchen and a huge open terrace Entire space You can contact me anytime with all the questions  and I will try to accomodate The House offers easy access to Manhattan. 7 minutes ride by bus or 2 stoops by train to Staten Island Ferry. SI Ferry is free and it takes about 25 minutes to get to downtown Manhattan. Close to SI ferry and parking is available. Parking at at SI Ferry: a garage at Central Ave for $8 a day closes at midnight and an open lot at St. Marks place is open 24/7 for $17 a day Apartment has been recently renovated and is very bright and sunny, lots of windows.

reviews.comments: La casa y el barrio muy agradable todo bien

It was a very nice apartment, comfortable beds, provided items for kitchen  (pans, plates, etc), and bathroom  (few rolls of tp and towels). Had a balcony with great view.
The apartment was VERY HOT, making it uncomfortable. Better or more fans would be a great improvement. There was an ac however it did not do a whole lot.
Never saw the host but did have good communication with him by email and the day of check in by phone
very good aptment!!
The host canceled this reservation 62 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.
I enjoyed the trip. I love the apartment and the area.
Great apartment, the views from the balcony are fantastic! Easy parking and access to Staten island ferry for trips to Manhattan. Loads of room and beds were good.

The host was great!  He was very responsive and communications were very clear for check-in.  The apartment was clean and was of a size perfect for our group.  Great views of lower Manhattan and the Statue of Liberty from the porch.  Neighborhood is not the greatest - we were only there for an overnight, so it wasn't an issue.  My only suggestion:  we stayed during a couple of the hottest days of the year and the ceiling fans and two portable air conditioners weren't enough to cut the heat.

The flat is at the top of a big house with 3 bedrooms and a living room which can easily be used as an extra bedroom.
The best is the huge terrace covered with a wonderful view on manhattan.
There are transportations all the night in area leading to southern manhattan in one hour door to door.

We had a great time here. The place is spacious and the view from the balcony is amazing!
The ride on the ferry every was a nice way to start and end our days in manhattan and around!
Great place!

We enjoyed the view and the neighborhood however the home was very hot during the day. There was a window air conditioner and a stand up air conditioner that cooled the house at night in the rooms they were located. There were no bowls for cereal and minimum dishes. 
The stay was pleasant given we weren't there most of the time. The view was BEAUTIFUL!

Very good. 
Very clean. 
Very nice. 
Easy to text or call the owner. Very nice person.

This is a great place! Getting in touch with Sergey about checking in was very easy and in general, he always responded back really quickly. We were on the top floor so we had access to the roof top area, which gave us a great view of Staten Island as well as Manhattan. Parking was easy and in terms of location, it was only a short distance to the ferry. The only thing to note is that it could be a little hot in the apartment -- I think the fans and AC units (located in each of the individual rooms) helped but it was still quite hot during the day. It wasn't that big of an issue later in the night so if you're spending most of your day out, it might not be a big deal.

Great place. The apartment is beautiful on the inside and out. The commute into the city could be a bit long but once you get the ferry and buses all figured out it is doable and way better for the price of staying on Manhatten.

Our stay included sharing the place between two couples. Everyone loved it. We would definitely stay here again as the value was great. 

The view was great. Check in was easy and only spoke with the host once. As mentioned in other reviews, the place does tend to get hot. For us, it wasn't too bad since the weather was cooler. Parking wasn't too bad, but don't be surprised if you need to park at the end of the street. The neighborhood seemed safe, so it wasn't an issue. Sergey did say we could park in the driveway, but I did not want to block other occupants of the house (This listing is for the top unit). 

The apartment did have 4 beds although only one of the rooms wouldn't be considered private. You had to access one of the bedrooms through a den type room (listed as a bedroom). Not a problem for us, but keep it in mind if you are expecting 4 private bedrooms. The living room is also listed as a bedroom, however it does have a door to make it private. To get to the balcony, you will need to go through the living room. 

The amenities were good. The free wifi was great and I was able to get 100Mbps down and 100Mbps up on a speed test. Unfortunately, the wifi signal did not reach to the kitchen (this could be a device issue). 4 towels were provided (we had 4 guests) along with 2 rolls of toilet paper. The dishes were minimal, but were adequate. We had 3 bowls and about the same amount of plates. Silverware wasn't an issue. There are no hangers listed in the amenities, but plastic store type hangers are provided and were appreciated. We did not use the tv as we mainly used the place as a sleeping place and then took the ferry to the city. 

We drove our car to the garage located on Central Avenue (next to the Staten Island Criminal Court) and walked to the ferry terminal . Cost was $8/day but it does close at midnight. Ferry did take about a 30 minute ride to the city, but was a fun way to get there.

The neighborhood isn't that fancy or new, but we did feel comfortable and safe. Look beyond the buildings and you will see that this is a middle income neighborhood. Expect real New York and not the 1% neighborhoods. (I only mention this because 1 other review mentioned the neighborhood not being the greatest).
This is a good place with a nice view from the balcony. Te commute to Manhattan is a little bit long, aprox 45 minutes.

Ensemble tr√®s propre
Bien situ√© √† staten  Island

Le logement est tr√®s bien situ√©. On peut voir la Statue de la Libert√© du balcon et de la cuisine. On se gare facilement. Le logement est bien situ√© pour aller √† Manhattan. Le Staten Island Ferry permet d'arriver √† la pointe sud de Manhattan et il est gratuit. Le logement est propre et les lits sont confortables. Il manque cependant de la vaisselle (seulement 3 grandes assiettes) et des chaises (seulement 5 chaises) pour que le logement convienne parfaitement √† plus de 4 personnes.

Its a nice property with a good view to the City of New York in day or night.
Neighborhood area is quiet and close to local shops but it would be good if there is a printed guideline for the guest to inform surounding area within walking distance.

The apartment was very nice.  Clean, plenty of room.  The view from the patio was great.  Had everything we needed.  We had a great time and would definitely stay here again.  Easy access to parking.  Drove our car and parked at the lot next to the Ferry terminal, $8 a day, free on Sunday!  Enjoyed taking the ferry back and forth, gave us time to relax.
Would stay here again!

We really enjoyed our stay here. The apartment has a ton of room and is very clean and neat. We drove to the ferry parking daily and it was a short drive. We were cold the first night because the heat cuts off at 9 pm (we're from South Georgia) and the downstairs unit had control of valve and Sergey was very helpful and brought us heaters. He was a great host! We never met him and he let us do our thing and was very responsive to texts! Thank you for a great stay!

There is plenty of room for a large family. We have 4 adult children and they each had their own place to sleep. The place is clean and the building is an adorable historic brownstone. We wish it was closer to the ferry but it was no problem getting an Uber or taxi to get us there and back every day. Everything related to reserving the place and checking in and out was as smooth as it could be. I'd stay there again for sure!

Place was spotless. Beds comfortable.  Very spacious and great value. The host was very timely getting back to us and totally accommodated a few special requests. The view from the balcony was great. If there was anything negative,  I would say it was the walk up to floor 3, but we knew that before we booked.  It was just that after a full day of sightseeing in the city, it was somewhat challenging to make it up the steps.  There was a helpful book in the rental that mapped out neighborhood conveniences. Overall a wonderful experience.

We had a great time here. The view from the balcony is amazing! The Ferry is a great way to start and end your days with when going to manhattan!
Great place!

An excellent house with an historic story. Great facilities and a view of Manhattan that is simply wonderful. The apartment does require entry via numerous stairs, so keep that in mind when booking. It provides excellent access to the ferry (a short 5 min drive) for those long days exploring NYC. Great value and off street parking is a bonus! We felt like we were in our own little piece of paradise having 'sundowners' overlooking Manhattan. We will definitely stay again.

Het huis bestaat uit een ruime bovenverdieping en is geschikt voor 6 personen (3x2 bedden). Huis is compleet en de eigenaar reageert heel snel op berichtjes en is erg behulpzaam wat het verblijf goed maakt.
De buurt is verzorgd maar ook wat armoedig. Supermarkt in de buurt maar reken op meer dan 20 minuten lopen of met de bus.
Appartement is goed bereikbaar met openbaar vervoer maar bijelkaar neemt het best wel veel tijd met de ferry en metro om downtown te komen.
In alle kamers is airconditioning wat heel prettig is bij hete dagen.
Het is een prettig verblijf maar de afstand is ons tegen gevallen.
Beautiful apartment in a nice house, stunning views over the skyline of NYC. Takes a little time to get into downtown Manhattan via Staten Island Ferry. Clear recommendation!  Thanks a lot.

Met 5 man prima plek, maar in de keuken stonden maar 4 stoelen. Uitzicht op New York is prachtig. Alleen contact met verhuurder via telefoon of app, niet persoonlijk gesproken, maar reageert snel. Verwacht geen gevulde kastjes met kruiden, het minimum is aanwezig. Alle kamers hebben airco, wat erg fijn is met 30 graden. Afstand naar Manhattan is goed te doen (bus & veerboot) in ongeveer 45 minuten.

Parfait, √† une demi heure (√† pied) du ferry pour Manhattan.Le Ferry est gratuit et fonctionne 24h sur 24. La vue du balcon sur New-York  est fabuleuse. Petite rue tranquille, pas de probl√®me de stationnement. Quartier tr√®s calme.

Die Wohnung ist sehr gross und ruhig gelegen mit den 3 Schlafzimmern, genau wie beschrieben. Die Strasse scheint sicher und die H√§user in der Strasse sind recht heimelig.  Der Check- in verlief problemlos. Der Schl√ºssel zur Wohnung ist in einem K√§stchen, das man mit der PIN  √∂ffnen kann. Sehr sch√∂nes Ambiente  im Haus. Die Kr√∂nung ist die riesige Terrasse mit Blick auf Manhattan, ein super Highlight , auch bei Hitze sch√∂n luftig.
Die √úberf√§hrt mit der kostenlosen F√§hre ist ein Erlebnis und spart eine Cruise zur Freiheitsstatue, allerdings dauert es von der Wohnung bis Manhattan doch ca. 1 Std , wobei eine halbe Std f√ºr die √úberfahrt gebraucht wird  . √ñffentliche Verkehrsmittel  (Bus) f√§hrt in der N√§he ab. Herrliche Erholung nach einem anstrengenden Tag in Manhattan.  Wenn man die Anreise in Kauf nehmen m√∂chte ein super Tip!

Sergey and natalia were great hosts. Any questions or concerns i had they responded back within minutes! The view of manhattan from the porch is beautiful especially at night! The home is also located in a quiet neighborhood which is a plus. Definitely recommend staying here
Beautiful views of the city! Very nice clean apartment, fit all of our needs and very spacious. I would definitely stay here again!
Great house. Close to ferry. Wonderful view from balcony. Spacious apartment. Would stay again.

Great place with amazing views from the balcony towards Manhattan. Check-in was easy, the apartment was clean. The toilet didn't work at first but it got fixed quickly so it didn't cause big trouble. recomendable, muy linda casa

Big space and able to accomadate a large group, Space is dated but it works ... easy Uber to ferry. Limited food options in neighborhood

Terrific time had by all. We managed to fit five adults and three little ones on air beds. Easy to get in and out of city. Natalia was very responsive to communication. We were on the top floor and we had a lot of stairs to climb. Thank you
We enjoyed our stay here. We would recommend it for anyone that is interested in a nice place to stay in Staten Island.

Close to ferry, which was nice. Place could've been cleaner. The kitchen had bare minimum cutlery, cups, plates, coffee maker. When my sister took a shower, she discovered that there was a ton of shaved off body hair that was inside of the towel. There was a giant pile.. that was disgusting.

Great views of Manhattan from the balcony. A gem of an old building that could benefit from some work but it looks like  the current owners are doing that. A quiet road so quite peaceful. A car is really needed - or taxi to the ferry. 
Quick responses from Sergey and partner. 
Enjoyed time there.

Location is convenient to the Staten Island Ferry. However if you are coming in late to the apartment, you will find yourself without a parking spot due to mainly it being street parking.  Tenant staying in lower level blocks the driveway, only allowing them to park. E-mailed the host and she was very response and said she spoke with tenant. Tenant said they would respect our request. The request was for them to pull all the way into the driveway because the driveway was wide enough to fit two cars if the had pull all the way in towards the garage. We requested this on day two. Tenant continued to block driveway until the last day we were there. We stayed Mon-Fri. We decided not to complain to host. I know she probably did the best she could with the other tenant. Other than that we loved that it was a short distance to Staten Island ferry. Having to find street parking after coming in late each night was our only issue.
Nice, clean and quiet house in Staten Island. Close to public transportation.

Nice apartment in a nice quiet neighbourhood.

Had everything as described. A/C was a blessing as temps were 30C.

Great price, would recommend and would stay again.

Great view, make sure you have your own shampoo to make sure there is enough. Sergey was responsive, clean space, convenient. Great deal for the price. Would stay here again
Spacious apartment, great for 7 people. We loved the views of Manhattan from the terrace. Check in and out was easy.
Really cool apartment, amazing balcony off the master bedroom and really easy to get to manhattan without a car

The view is great !!!!! the host was very quickly to answer me! The house was okay to me and my family a total of 7 . We also found parking easy at the street and is close to the ferry but not to go walking with kids which was my case I couldn‚Äôt do it ! But certainly could be done for people without health injuries or with kids! But in the end it was great to stay there !
We enjoyed our stay at this place and the convenience to the Staten Island Ferry, which would take us into NYC!  My family agreed that they would stay here again on future visits.
Great place to stay with city view
Great location! Great balcony and views! Convenient to ferry!

This was the second time we stayed at this apartment and again it didn't disappoint. The view alone makes this place worth every pennie.  Sergey and Natalie were super nice and responded really quick.
Everything was excellent i will come Back at The same apartment The Lady clean is a Good person
Expect to climb stairs to get into the apartment on the top floor.
The view from the top floor is spectacular! Place is clean and has pretty much everything you need.

Alojamiento practico y funcional. Buenas camas y ducha. No hay muchas opciones  para opciones de comida y super. Recomiendo traer desde Manhattan o llegar ya cenados. Excelente la llegada autonoma que facilita arribar a cualquier hora. Estuvimos muy comodos.
Close to NYC start line! Super close to Manhattan ferry. Ample street parking. A true NYC experience!
Super convenient and great value! The view was an amazing bonus. Easy parking and spacious..

We recommend City Views Close to SI Ferry Airbnb.  It has a gorgeous view of Manhattan and getting to the Ferry is just a short walk and a bus ride away.  Very convenient.

We thoroughly enjoyed our stay.

Thank you Sergey!

This place was exactly like pictured. It was a one block walk to the bus stop that took us right to the ferry. They answered all questions we had. The place was clean and safe. Will stay here again if we decide to come back to nyc.

This is a great and convenient place to stay. It is a very historic home and convenient for our travels. It was also very nice that we could park in the driveway. When we were there,  there was not a lot of traffic so we could park on the street also. During a busy time, the drive way would be a great convenience. 
Our arrival was also very easy. Due to flight cancellations, we did not arrive until 3 am, so it was nice we could enter without bothering anyone.

We enjoyed our stay here very much!  The place was very clean and comfortable.  It was right by the ocean, shops, grocery store, restaurants and bars.  The flat was modern and new.  Highly recommended.  Transportation (bus) nearby.   Wonderful!

We stayed at the appartment for 5 days and had a nice stay. It's nearby the sea in a quiet area of porto. You find everthing you need, even for a longer stay. There's a washing maschine, dish washer, mirco wave etc. 
We enjoyed our time there and would go book again! The only negative point: we had to wait a long time in front of the appartment to get our keys, because of an organisational missunderstanding - annoying but I guess it isn't usual.

The apartment is exactly like on the photos: clean, modern, right next to the beach and spacious enough for a family of four. The bathroom and bedrooms are very nice and big. Super market is two minutes walking from the apartment. Porto city center is a 15 minute bus ride away. Communication with the host was always fast and clear. We were even provided with a welcoming gift! 
There are, however, two downsides: the apartment is not equipped with an airconditioner or fan (which is not disastrous, but it can get pretty hot if you're not used to Portugese summers), and sounds from upstairs neighbours and the busy road it lies on can be heard at night. If you're a light sleeper, I suggest taking soundproof earplugs with you. 
Otherwise, it's a beautiful apartment if you want to enjoy both the city center of Porto and the beach!

name: Modern bright spacious duplex apartment
summary: Modern two floor apartment in a newly renovated historic townhouse on a quiet tree-lined street. Private entrance, two bedrooms each with private en-suite bathroom, additional sofa bed for 2 people, large kitchen/living/dining area, private patio with grill, washer and dryer, central air conditioning and heating, wifi, cable TV. Only 3 minutes from the subway station with express A and D trains.
space: The apartment occupies the lower two floors of a newly renovated 4-floor Harlem townhouse. It has its own private entrance round the back of the house that opens out onto the private patio. You'll love the quiet, safe, tree-lined street, proximity to the subway, en-suite bathrooms in both bedrooms, brand new kitchen with quartz countertops and dishwasher, 55" TV, patio with sofa and grill, washer and dryer, and the silent central AC and heat (rare in NYC). The house is also very quiet at night, unlike some of the apartments and hotels downtown.
description: Modern two floor apartment in a newly renovated historic townhouse on a quiet tree-lined street. Private entrance, two bedrooms each with private en-suite bathroom, additional sofa bed for 2 people, large kitchen/living/dining area, private patio with grill, washer and dryer, central air conditioning and heating, wifi, cable TV. Only 3 minutes from the subway station with express A and D trains. The apartment occupies the lower two floors of a newly renovated 4-floor Harlem townhouse. It has its own private entrance round the back of the house that opens out onto the private patio. You'll love the quiet, safe, tree-lined street, proximity to the subway, en-suite bathrooms in both bedrooms, brand new kitchen with quartz countertops and dishwasher, 55" TV, patio with sofa and grill, washer and dryer, and the silent central AC and heat (rare in NYC). The house is also very quiet at night, unlike some of the apartments and hotels downtown. You will have the entire bottom two floors of the
neighborhood_overview: Harlem is a diverse residential neighborhood in upper Manhattan that is home to the famous Apollo Theatre, Red Rooster restaurant, numerous green spaces and gospel churches. Our house is located in a leafy, hilly, and quiet part of the city.
notes: There are several nice coffee shops around the corner and many good restaurants within walking distance.
transit: 145th St subway station is 3 minutes walk away, giving you access to the A and D express lines (takes you downtown in 10-15 mins) and the local B and C lines that stop at all the local stops down Central Park West. There is also free street parking.
access: You will have the entire bottom two floors of the house and the back yard through your own private entrance. Note that you go down stairs to get into the apartment and there are stairs within the apartment. Therefore, the apartment may not be suitable for elderly or disabled people.
interaction: We live on the top two floors of the house so will be available should you need anything.
house_rules: Shoes off in the house. No smoking in the house (you will forfeit your deposit if you do). No parties. No noise outside after dark. No guests other than those listed in the booking.

host.host_location: New York, New York, United States
host.host_about: We're an international couple who live in New York City.

reviews.comments: Very nice, new and complete apartament. You have everything hoy need and more! Only 1 block from subway. VERY KIND AND NICE OWNERS.

Jonathan was a great host, and the apartment was clean, spacious and comfortable. There were three in our party and each person had his own space and a bed to sleep in, which is a pretty big luxury in NYC at this price point. 
Jonathan was very attentive, and was able to quickly accommodate requests for an iron, a fan, and a spare set of keys shortly after our arrival. All communication was excellent and we were confident that if we needed anything, Jonathan would be available quickly. 
Location for the apartment is a short walk from a major subway line which will get you into the heart of things in Manhattan.  It's clear that this area of Harlem is "up and coming" but we felt safe in and around the apartment. 
I recommend Jonathan and this apartment without hesitation.

The place was amazing. It was clean, well maintained and very easy to find and get into. I really Joe close it was to a lot of good restaurants.

departamento de 2 niveles que me gusto mucho, los dos dormitorios son bastante c√≥modos y con todo lo necesario para atender 3 personas. 2-level department that I really liked, the two bedrooms are very comfortable and with everything you need to serve 3 people. The first floor has everything you need for day to day, only slightly uncomfortable sofa bed. I really liked the neighborhood, all to buy and next to the subway. Jonathan did not talk much, but it shows that you have everything ready to receive you in good shape.

Jonathan was quick to respond and was very helpful, his place was lovely. Very modern, clean and had an excellent seating area out back. The location was perfect, close to the subway and restaurants. Highly recommend  staying at this place for a visit.

Our hosts met us upon arrival, and as it was raining, gave us an umbrella. The home was spacious, clean and had everything we needed. The internet connection was not very stable, which is probably fine for most folks, but we work remotely and it was noticeable with our usage patterns.

The neighborhood is great, but we felt very much like we were part of the gentrification problem: which we are. So it felt uncomfortable. But, everything we needed was nearby and there were great places for food, coffee etc...

Magnifique appartement, propre, tr√®s bien √©quip√©. Situation parfaite √† 3 min de la station 145 street et √† 15 min de Time Square via la ligne express. Jonathan nous a pr√©par√© un d√©tails des principaux commerces et restaurant du coin. Tr√®s bien organis√©. Je recommande Jonathan sans h√©siter √† tout niveau! Merci encore!
We had a wonderfull time in New York, the apartment is very nice and so oclose to a subway station. Jonathan gave us a list of recomended places to go  in the area.
Everything was perfect! Jonathan is a great! The apartment comfortable and clean! We'll come back here!
I reached out to Jonathan on random things, honestly not sure if he would even know and he took the time to research subway options and give me insights for helping me plan.

Wir waren als Familie (4 erwachsene) in der Unterkunft von Jonathan. Die Unterkunft war sehr sauber und bot ausreichend Platz. Harlem ist ein super Ausgangspunkt, um NY zu erkunden. Die Metro ist 5 Minuten entfernt und man ist in 15 Minuten in Manhattan. Klasse ist auch, das man direkt vom JFK mit der Metro ohne umsteigen zur Unterkunft kommt. Kleiner Tipp zum fr√ºhst√ºcken: the sugar hill cafe (5 Minuten von der Unterkunft entfernt)

Apartamento muito bom. Deu tudo certo, nada fora do planejado.

You will love this place. The neighborhood was wonderful! You have to go to the Italian restaurant Fumo. The spinach salad was to die for. Johnathan was so responsive and the place was great. My sister said she doesn't see any reason to stay any other place when we come to New York. We walked a lot. Lyft/Uber is always 5 mins or less away. We didn't take the subway at all but there is a station up the hill and one block over. You will not be disappointed.
clean

This apartment was very clean and cozy. It was what we were expecting and then some. The queen size bed was extremely comfortable, the twin not so much but my 11 year old slept in it and had no complaints. The host Jonathon was very kind and communicated well with us throughout our stay. The only thing that I would mention that was a problem for us was that there was only a mini refrigerator which was fine because we ate out most of the time, however we had problems having ice for our adult beverages because the freezer was not big enough for bagged ice and there was no ice maker, this is not a complaint only constructive criticism...

Everything was perfekt. We had everything we needed and the communication with jonathan was very easy and friendly. The flat is perfekt to get to know new york and the subway is very close...we would definetely repeat, thank you jonathan! :)

Estivemos no apartamento eu, minha esposa e minha filha de 4 anos. O apartamento √© exatamente como descrito nas fotos. O processo de check-in e check-out foi super simples. A comunica√ß√£o com Jonathan foi sempre muito r√°pida. Ele nos ajudou bastante em nossa estadia em New York. Muito obrigado!

We had a fabulous 9 days in the apartment.  It was very well equipped and very clean.  Nice outside seating area, but it was a bit cool to use, which was a shame.  The apartment is private and extremely quiet at night.  The neighbourhood was great. All amenities were within a 5 minute walk, including food store, banks, subway and liquor store.  We ate out locally a couple of times at The Edge - recommend it.  Lovely bistros with several food influences and the Grange.  Food here was also excellent and we were treated to live jazz on the Sunday.

We'd highly recommend a stroll through St Nicholas Park.  Despite being in Harlem, we could get the express train to downtown Manhattan in 15 minutes.  Local people were very friendly, saying hello, as we walked up the street.  

There was a previous comment from another renter about the fridge size.  It's actually a standard UK under the counter fridge with an ice box.  Perfect to meet  our needs as we are in most evenings.

We would highly recommend this accommodation.  It took us just over an hour to get there from the apartment and it only cost us $7.75 each.

It was also great for us that there was a flexible check out time as our flight wasn't until 10pm.  If we were in a hotel, we would have been wandering around New York with suit cases.  Instead we were able to go for a walk through the parks and take our time getting the airport without any stress.

We didn't get to meet Jonathan but communication was excellent.  We did get to meet Kieran (apologies if spelling is wrong!), who was very friendly and asked if we needed anything.

WOW!! We had an amazing stay in New York. The apartment was so beautiful and super clean! It is easy to go downtown and Supermarkets, Starbucks or anything you might need is just around the corner. I can strongly recommend to anyone to stay in this place!! We absolutely loved it!! 
Jonathan is the reason why i would chose Airbnb over an hotel at any time. Thank you Jonathan for being such an excellent host!

My group and I stayed here for 1 month and we absolutely loved it! Location was perfect for us (working in the Bronx) and the place felt like home away from home  Jonathan went above and beyond to ensure we had everything we needed, and was always quick to reply. Will definitely be returning next time I'm in New York!

This was a wonderful place, in a great neighborhood. Check-in was very easy and owners promptly responded to questions. Public transit to unit was available 24/7. Unit was spacious and elegant. I would recommend unit for travels that want to stay in neighborhood and slightly outside of the hustle and bustle.
Super bel apart, chic, propre.
Great place--perfect location and clean!

Big apartment near subway station and sorrounded by shops, supermarkets and 'delis'. Clean and with all 'mod. cons.' , including a fast wi-fi connection. I will recomend it to other tourist visiting New York.

Great hosts

This is a great spacious two bedroom duplex in Harlem,  The apartment has been decorated to a high specification, extremely clean and stylish.  Jonathan was a wonderful host, very thoughtful and personable, always responded very quickly to any queries, and provided helpful travel guides and transport maps of how to get around; and interesting places and eatery near by.  Thank you Jonathan for being a great host!

The apartment is exactly as descripted. Everything is very good, the laundry room is very usefull.
The apartment is well located, close to the principal subway, 15-20minutes to lower Manhattan, and the neigboorhood is nice.
Jonathan booked a taxi for us, that was VERY cool, he helped a lot.
I definitely recommand you this apartment for a nice stay in New York!
Thanks for everything!

Great space. 2 full baths and 1 half bath, unheard of in NYC. Subway one block away, with A train to get to 59th st in only two stops. Coffee shop 1/2 block away, and amazing breakfast place only one block away.

Very nice place. Easy check in process. The place was extremely clean on arrival. Great set up if you have 4-5 people in your party. Having 2.5 bathrooms was really nice. There's a great breakfast place called the edge Harlem down the street. Also, the bed in the master was very comfortable.
Very clean, fantastic location for easy access to public transportation.
